intro: Pappobolus microphyllus var. dillonii, commonly known as the Dillon's small-leaved pappobolus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered white flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
